alert.note: Alert for Brown; Spink (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued January 12 at 5:17PM MST until January 15 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST SATURDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO MIDNIGHT CST SATURDAY NIGHT... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM SATURDAY TO NOON CST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills ranging from 25 below to 35 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills ranging from 35 below to 45 below zero. * WHERE...Brown and Spink Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 6 AM CST Saturday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from midnight tonight to midnight CST Saturday night. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 6 AM Saturday to noon CST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
